metadata.title: CVE-2022-30790 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Das U-Boot 2022.01 has a Buffer Overflow, a different issue thanCVE-2022-30552.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot-amlogic - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-exynos - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-imx - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-microchip - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-mvebu - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-omap - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-qcom - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-qemu - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-rockchip - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-rpi - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-sifive - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-stm32 - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-sunxi - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-tegra - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-tools - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4').
u-boot-nezha package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
